modName: Civil War without the Main Quest
summary: For non-Dovahkiin characters who avoid the main quest.  No script, just a few edits in the CK allowing the civil war to be playable.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#6aa84f][b]Description[/b][/color]

This is only for characters you aren't playing as the Dovahkiin, avoiding the main quest, but wish to have in the civil war.

The early civil war quest [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Message_to_Whiterun_%28Imperial%29]Message to Whiterun[/url] has a requirement that the main quest [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Dragon_Rising]Dragon Rising [/url]must first be completed.  This is just a few edits in the CK to remove that requirement from the player dialogue with Balgruuf.  No scripts or adjustments to existing scripts were needed.

[color=#cc4125][b]Warning:[/b][/color]  [color=#cc4125]D[/color][color=#cc4125]e-activate this mod for any characters that will be playing the main quest. [/color] Any character using this mod and completing the civil war won't be able to advance the main quest.  I recommend keeping a separate plugins.txt file for each character to quickly swap and keep track of different sets of mods.  For example, vanilla race characters don't need Ningheim or Race Compatibility, etc.  This prevents loading up mods you'll never use on a given character, and also ensures mods like this remain separated between your characters.

There are a number of requests to work around this issue so the main quest can still be played.  I'm looking into it but the quest interface and scripting are not my forte, so I can't make any promises.  I didn't consider this originally as it was never the goal of this mod.  If you'd like to help please visit the comments.  I can grant you access to edit this page on the Nexus so everyone can update rather than uninstall / install a different mod.  It's very light-weight though, so it doesn't really matter.  If you'd rather start your own separate mod no permissions are needed, but please post a comment to let these folks know. :)

[color=#6aa84f][b]Installation[/b][/color]

Since it's only edits in the CK, it's just a single .esp file. 

1) Drop it in the 'data' directory.

2) Add it to plugins.txt in ...\App Data\Local\Skyrim\.  The load-order shouldn't matter as long as it's below the .esm masters. 

Alternatively, activate it in the "Data Files" section of the launcher, but I don't recommend using it.  I've seen it randomly mess with my load-order (a hiccup while it's phoning home to Valve's workshop I'd guess? ugh) and it's unnecessary since everything it does can easily be done manually.  Sorry for the mini-rant, I just can't endorse using the launcher.

[color=#6aa84f][b]Known Issues[/b][/color]
[color=#6aa84f]
[color=#ffffff]None as long as you're not playing the main quest.  [color=#6aa84f][color=#ffffff]As with any mod, make sure you have a backup of your save before installing.[/color][/color]  I made this in May and since then have mostly been playing the same character with no issues.[/color]  [color=#ffffff]I've also tested it under a few different circumstances, but nothing extensive.  The edits are straight-forward so I don't believe I missed anything, but please let me know if you encounter a problem.[/color][b]

Compatibility[/b][/color]

This only modifies player dialogue with Balgruuf in the CW03 quest, so that's the only possible conflict.  I don't use any civil war mods so I'm not familiar with any that do, but I assume there are some.  If you'd like help determining this, let me know which mod you're using in the comments and I'll download and check it out.

[Edit] I looked in Arthmoor's Alternate Start - Live Another Life mod and it doesn't appear to make edits with this quest, should be no conflict there.

[color=#6aa84f][b]Requirements

[/b][/color]None.

[color=#6aa84f][b]Permission[/b][/color]

None needed.

[color=#6aa84f][b]Thanks[/b][b]![/b][/color]

Bethesda, the Nexus, and modders everywhere.
